meta.title: Naples Airport to Positano by Bus – Step-by-Step
meta.description: Take the Curreri shuttle to Sorrento, then the SITA bus to Positano (Chiesa Nuova). Photos, timetable tips, and walking directions to Hostel Brikette.

content.overview:
Tip 1: For the Sorrento to Positano timetable, check the official schedule.
Tip 2: For Naples Airport to Sorrento, see Curreri Viaggi (select "Da Napoli Aeroporto - Per Sorrento"). You can also buy your shuttle ticket there.
content.naplesAirport: Exit the arrivals hall straight to the bus stands. Buy a Curreri Viaggi ticket to Sorrento (online or at the kiosk) and wait at the marked bay. Coaches run roughly every 60-90 minutes; in peak months arrive 15 minutes early to secure a seat.
content.sorrentoStation:
- Disembark at Sorrento's main station, which is both the train and bus hub.
- From the forecourt, board the SITA bus toward Amalfi (Positano is an intermediate stop).
- Need a ticket? Buy from the bar or newsstand next to the stands before you queue.
- When you board, the driver will stamp or tear your ticket. Keep it handy for inspectors.
content.timetable: The SITA timetable lists stops as rows and lettered journeys as columns. Match your departure stop with the column letter for your travel day: Monday–Saturday trips are under columns F and G; Sunday and public holiday departures are under G and H.
content.positanoStop: Stay on the bus until the Chiesa Nuova stop in Positano. It sits about 140 m (450 ft) from the hostel outside Bar Internazionale. Use the photo to confirm you're at the right place before you hop off.
content.walk:
From the stop, walk a little over 100 m / 330 ft along Via G. Marconi.
Turn right at the small lane and follow the steps up to our front door.
Want turn-by-turn directions? Open the same route in Google Maps.
content.spotSign: As you approach, look for the Hostel Brikette sign by the second-floor terrace. Walk past it, follow the bend in the road, and climb the stairs on the right to reach reception.
